greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangular array having n-th row g(n) defined in Comments.
comment: Let g(0) = (0) and for n > 0, define g(n) inductively as the concatenation of g(n-1) and the numbers k/2 as k ranges through the even numbers k in g(n-1).  Every nonnegative integer appears infinitely many times.  For the limiting ratio of lengths of consecutive rows, see A274192.
mathematica: g[0] = {0}; z = 14; g[n_] := g[n] = Join[g[n - 1] + 1, (1/2) Select[g[n - 1], IntegerQ[#/2] &]]; Flatten[Table[g[n], {n, 0, z}]]
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jun 13 2016
